comment: Professor Griffin made me drop my french minor. He's honestly just not a nice guy. He picks favorites and openly shames people in front of the whole class. You have to read a textbook ENTIRELY in french every night or you WONT PASS. The tests are exactly the homework and the final is all of the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Honestly at first I loved griffin but hes pretty rude. Also at the end of the year with our portfolio, I turned it in twice a week in advance and he gave me a zero. I tried to email him multiple times and got emails coming back saying the recipients email wouldnt accept them. I ended up with a grade that isnt accurate to my other grades.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Griffin is a pretty average professor in class. He assigns a ton of book work for homework that you absolutely HAVE to do in order to pass and keep up in class which can be a pain. his tests are very straightforward and are exactly the same as the homework. He let us use our textbook and notes on the tests and finals. Not too harsh on papers
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests? Not many

comment: Dr. Griffin's intentions come from a good place. However, his teaching methods are not quite as effective as he may think. Learning French is hard enough, but this man comes from the woods of the Carolinas and his southern drawl is utterly unbearable. Furthermore, he would get the award for making his students feel most uncomfortable in class. RUN!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His teaching method consists of assigning homework in the textbook every day, then he spends the entire class going over the homework. Tests were pretty easy because they were mostly all taken from the homework, and he does a review before the test. However, he is a very boring teacher and makes a lot of inappropriate jokes
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Griffin means well but he didn't teach very well. He wanted us all to be way more advanced than we actually are. He makes offensive jokes and he doesn't seem to respect his students. He means well but it gets super lost in translation.
He really cares about his students, he is funny & a great teacher
The lectures can get boring because there's a lot of repetition, but he knows the subject very well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Griffin has a lot of knowledge of French Grammar, but his teaching style is not the best. He only lectures and doesn't give much opportunity for practice . He gives 5 in class writings & doesn't give the prompt until right before and you have 10-15 mins to write 2 paragraphs. 4 out of class compositions and only 3 test (over 25 chapters).
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Really nice guy but he won't help you in the end. He wouldnt even bump my 89 to a 90. His teaching style is reading everything directly from the textbook, and it's the exact same thing eveyday so be ready to be super bored. He's funny and likes participation and is very dedicated to his job.

Really nice guy but he wont do anything to help you in the end. Everyday is the same so be ready to be super bored if you have him. Won't bump an 89 to a 90 so dont even try. He teaches directly from the textbook, but i don't feel like I learned anything. Grades compositions really hard.

Expects you to be studying French every second of every day, but in a way makes you want to do so.  The more you try hard and improve, the better grade you'll get.  Really nice guy and great at French.

Dr. Griffin is the model for what a professor ought to be.  He is passionate about French, and makes it contagious.  Because he's a non-native speaker, he is able to share great techniques for understanding French grammar.  Most of all, he is a born teacher who obviously enjoys  sharing the pleasure of becoming proficient in another language.

Dr. Griffin made a grammar and composition course quite enjoyable for the subject matter. I learned far more about French this semester than I have in previous courses. A definite must take for those wanting to learn French, but he does make you work for your grade. However, he is always willing to help.

Great professor. You can tell he enjoys his job & loves French. Not many tests. Lots of writing in FREN 3200, especially. Grammar class is straightforward. He is funny as well, which makes class enjoyable. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he won't respect you as much if you don't come on a regular basis, & he's someone you don't want to disappoint.
Great teacher, but biased! If you are/were in the military take his classes. He hands out A and B like candy, even if you fail his exams!

BEST French Prof I've had so far. Cuts to the chase and teaches what we need to know with no nonsense assignments.  Gives you every chance to do well, he's not out to trip you up. He's obviously been around and isn't worried about proving anything, he just enjoys teaching French.  Great sense of humor and makes learning grammar as fun as possible.

J'adore Dr. Griffin! He expects you to be well-prepared before class, but if you do your hw, participate but don't argue with him you will do well and your French will improve a lot. I will miss his class.

Great prof, not afraid to change the non sense imposed by the department such as the stupid cocktail party to fulfill the director of the program's ego.  Griffin is the man, take him, he is not going to be afraid to fight for you.

This was a wonderful professor, one of my favorites. He keeps the class very entertaining and educational at the same time. Many different grades go in the book, so no worries about messing up once and failing.

Wow. You know, I thought it would be difficult for someone to take something you love and turn it into something you despise. Nope. Griffin did that. This man is EXTREMELY confusing. He grades HORRIBLY. He is not funny or personable in any way. Unfortunately, you have to take this class for your major. Suck it up. It's gonna be an awful ride, kids.

Very nice guy.  Found that he doesn't really understand how to teach our class, meaning that he expects way beyond our capability.  It's November and we have 1 returned grade back and took an insanely difficult midterm just two days ago. No idea what my grade could be in the class  But again, nice guy I guess.

He's great at teaching French, but he's biased and favors certain students. He keeps the class entertaining but when it comes to grading essays sometimes it's extremely hard to make him happy. Good professor that knows and teaches French flawlessly, but weird personality.
He's now at Kennesaw; I had him at App State.  He was my favorite professor.  Teaching wasn't a job to him; I got the idea that even if he didn't have to be there, he would've shown up anyway.
Griffin was always helpful and very passionate about teaching. I would take him if I were you!
Very good teacher! One of the best french teachers, imo.
